alert.note: Alert for Big Lost Highlands, Copper Basin; Lost River Range; Lost River Valleys (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 13 at 1:55PM MDT by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORM APPROACHING MOORE... At 154 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Darlington, or 8 miles northeast of Grouse, moving east at 5 MPH. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 MPH, penny size hail, torrential rainfall, and frequent lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Arco, Darlington and Moore. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. If you observe flooding, debris flows, hail, or wind damage, please report your observations to the National Weather Service in Pocatello via phone, email, or social media, as soon as it is safe to do so.
